blurb_start:
Hi. I'm Jason Conover,
Front End Developer
&
summary:
I got my start in a small marketing department with big needs, so I learned everything from print and video production to Flash animation. I fell in love with web development and haven't looked back!
Since then I've had the opportunity to work in a wide variety of industries and business types—high tech, B2B, B2C, agency, corporate—you name it. Along the way I went back to college for a BA in Marketing just for good measure.
Currently I'm contracting as a UI Web Developer at T-Mobile. This position's taught me a lot about enterprise-level e-commerce, maintaining .NET and JAVA environments, and coordinating efforts with offshore developers.

projects.name: T-Mobile
projects.description:
Describing T-Mobile as ‘fast-paced’ is an understatement. This company rolls-out new products and initiatives at breakneck speeds! The good news… there’s never a dull moment!

Front End Development

Clean markup organizes content, CSS provides the presentation layer and enables responsive design, and JavaScript rounds it out, adding behavior to the mix. Developer toolbars such as Firebug help diagnose bugs, Visual Studio and Eclipse maintain .NET & JAVA solutions, and JIRA and daily Scrum calls keep projects organized.

projects.name: What"s New
projects.description:
I’ve been hard at work, learning new technologies and brushing-up on existing ones. And they’re all incorporated into this site!

AngularJS

I wanted to learn Angular but Codecademy tutorials only take you so far. So I built this site! Controllers, views, routing, directives—they’re all here.

GitHub

And speaking of Angular directives, check out a few of mine on GitHub!

LESS

Visually-formatted CSS without all the redundancy. What"s not to love?

Bootstrap

Bootstrap is a great way to get up and running quickly, speeding-up the mundane and allowing for quick prototyping.

Grunt

Nothing makes you feel like a hacker like running a Grunt build from the command line!

projects.name: WordPress
projects.description:
When it comes to skinning a WordPress site, there"s no need to reinvent the wheel—there are already thousands of free and low-cost themes to choose from. You can then further modify a theme to perfectly fit your needs.

Making it yours

Overwriting styles in a separate child stylesheet ensures that—even if they update the theme—your look and layout will be preserved.

You can also leverage the rich developer network to modify PHP functions and source plugins, which makes implementing features like Google Analytics a snap!

Responsive Design

While out-of-the-box responsive layouts are great, it"s always a good idea to test them thoroughly and modify/add additional breakpoints if necessary.

This is my seventh WordPress project and I"m sure there will be many more to come!

projects.name: Varolii
projects.description:
This Seattle-based Software as a Service (SaaS) provider (now Nuance Communications) relied heavily on the internet for marketing and lead generation.

Search Engine Optimization

Varolii was all about SEO. And that meant overhauling the CMS templates to output content in a meaningful hierarchy, using proper markup.

Now you"re giving search engines more than just data—you"re providing them with context as well!

projects.name: Wyndham Worldwide
projects.description:
Marketing dream vacations was fun—but it wasn"t without its challenges.

SEO: Letting the content speak for itself

By eliminating presentational artifacts from the markup—such as tables and layout graphics—you"re left with pure content. Now organize that content in a meaningful hierarchy and you can let the content speak for itself. True search engine optimization!

Better rankings in search results means more visibility. And more visibility means more business!

Web Analytics

JavaScript-based analytics really changed the game. I helped implement Omniture (now Adobe Analytics) that resulted in actionable data that helped us improve customer conversion rates and increase sales.

projects.name: Freelance
projects.description:
I"ve had the incredible opportunity to work on a number of exciting Microsoft campaigns during my time in Seattle.

HTML Email Development

Microsoft Business Solutions
When it came to B2B marketing, Microsoft was a stickler for backwards-compatibility. This project for DDB Direct had me hand-coding old-school HTML tables and ditching the CSS. The resulting email rendered perfectly across all platforms and devices.

Banner Ads

Windows Home Server
The good folks at Creature Seattle were asked to come up with a creative way of marketing Microsoft"s "Stay-at-Home Server" products. So to warm the public up to the idea, they created a children"s book entitled "Mommy, Why is There a Server in the House?" I was brought in to turn static comps into animated banners.

UX Design

Microsoft Hardware Sweepstakes
The Garrigan Lyman Group (GLG) had me creating assets for a sweepstakes campaign where users could enroll to win Microsoft hardware, such as ergonomic keyboards and HD webcams.
